column4: you're a high-ranking ubuntu guy -- ever hear of liborbit2 becoming non-functional upon a breezy-to-dapper upgrade?
nope
well, it appears to have happened to me
it's making firefox do a SIGILL, and i suspect it's what's causing synaptic to crash too
funky, tried reinstalling the thing?
liborbit2? yes. and firefox, too
and how did you determine it to be liborbit?
gdb
can you pastebin the gdb output please
well, i no longer have the window open, but i can recreate the backtrace. also, this is on a powerpc (g3)
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/33560/
that output seems incomplete
what's missing? looks ok to me
and try disabling assistive technologies/accessibility things
i'll have to log out for that, but now that you mention it, gok fails to start, complaining about a missing /dev/js0
well, it's the backtrace of only one thread and the actual signal is missing ;)
it's the thread that got the signal
fair enough ;)
the top line refers to the illegal instruction

i'll give turning off assistive devices a try now, and then i'm going to thanksgiving dinner with family and friends of family, so i won't be able to report back until another day. which channel would be the best one to receive such a report?
here
or a private /msg :)
to you? ok...
well, later...
